testAddingThreeNumbers

public void testAddingThreeNumbers()
This method evaluates the usage of the plus() method twice It calculates 3+4+5 and asserts that to value 15

testAddingTwoDigitNumbers

public void testAddingTwoDigitNumbers()
This tests adding two digit numbers. 12 + 25 and it asserts the result with 37

testAdditionAfterSubstraction

public void testAdditionAfterSubstraction()
This method tests an addition operation after a substraction using the clear() method in between. It calculates 9-4 = then calls clear() method and then calculates 3+4 and asserts if result equals 7

testMinusSingleDigit

public void testMinusSingleDigit()
This method tests single digit substractions. It calculates 9-4 and assert the result to 5

testPlusSingleDigit

public void testPlusSingleDigit()
This is to test the plus() method with single digits clears the calculator and then calculates 3+4 evaluates if result is corect, 7

testSubstractingThreeNumbers

public void testSubstractingThreeNumbers()
This method tests substracting three numbers 9-2-3 asserts teh result equals to 4

testSubstractingTwoDigitNumbers

public void testSubstractingTwoDigitNumbers()
This method tests substracting two digit numbers. It tests 25-13 and asserts it equals 12

testSubstractionAfterAddition

public void testSubstractionAfterAddition()
This method tests a substraction operation after an addition using the clear() method in between. It calculates 3+4 = then calls clear() method and then calculates 9-4 and asserts if result equals 5

testTwoConscutiveSubstractions

public void testTwoConscutiveSubstractions()
This method calculates two consecutive substractions. It uses the clear method in between to reset teh state of the calculator. On second operation 9-5 asserts that equals to 4

testTwoConsecutiveAdditions

public void testTwoConsecutiveAdditions()
This is to test two consecutive additions with clear() method call in between. It evaluates the second addition with data 3+4 asserts result equals to 7
